Package multirepogithubtool

Class RepoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Repo>
          • multirepogithubtool.RepoManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Repo>, java.util.Collection<Repo>, java.util.List<Repo>, java.util.RandomAccess
    public class RepoManager
extends java.util.ArrayList<Repo>
    An array list, and manager, of a bunch of repos. This class makes batch commands, like git pull, for a whole bunch of repos, easy. The repos can either be assembled from a folder of repos in memory, or pull from a github org. Be sure to use factories, and not the constructor, to create.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • cloneOrg

        public static RepoManager cloneOrg​(java.lang.String courseSpecs,
                                   java.lang.String repoNamesStartsWith,
                                   java.lang.String baseRepoName)
        Creates a repo manager by cloning all the repos whose names have have the given prefix in a GitHub organization.
        Parameters:
        courseSpecs - a file containing the course Specs for this course
        organization name: SIT-ECE
        answer location: /src/mypkg/my_answers.py
        moss id: 854481551
        language: python
        git access token: 680*************************272f44cbf811cdee
        repoNamesStartsWith - the repos that you want to clone, there names all start with ...
        baseRepoName - the name of the base repo
        Returns:
        a RepoManager that contains the clones
